text: Dosa is a dish from the Indian subcontinent. It is usually made using rice that is ground into a batter, but can also be made using other ingredients like semolina. The batter is put on a hot flat pan and formed into a circle to cook. Dosa or dosai is a basic part of the diet of people from South India, but can also be found all across the Indian subcontinent. Category:Indian food
title: Dosa (food)
